title: I always feel alone even when I'm not. Why is that? - Quora

response.answer_text: You feel this way because you are wise enough to recognize that ultimately it is impossible for any human being to fully connect with another. No matter how close you get to those near you, you can only share moments, when your life is so much more that moments. No person is completely understood by anyone else, ever. We are all alone. You can do nothing to change this reality, so your choice is how you want to respond to it. Religion offers hope that though no human has the capacity to fully understand and relate with you, a benevolent deity might. I personally prefer Christianity, but you have several to choose from. If your mind recoils from the idea of trying to relate to a deity that can never be proven to actually exist, then you can try other things to get your mind off of it; perhaps try to build close relationships with others, and see how close you can get to real understanding. Or, you could seek out physical solitude that matches your mental world, and become a hermit, living off the grid. Those are suggestions, but what I found really helped me when I reached the same point in my mental and emotional development was asking the question “Does it matter?” Do you need to be fully connected in order to find love, to enjoy friendship, to share sorrow? I find the answer is no. I have never truly known anyone, but I have truly loved twice, two wonderful women who stayed mysterious and exciting because I never knew just what they thought or felt about things. I have shared sorrow with strangers, not because I could relate, but because humans have the capacity to mourn with those who mourn. And I have found friendship where I least expected it, by being open to the idea that each person is who he is for reasons that are hidden from me, but meaningful to him. I don't have to understand why a person is who he is in order to enjoy his company, the mystery makes the company that much more enjoyable. It isn't all bad, being alone in your soul. It keeps a bit of magic and fear in relationships, ensuring that the stakes stay high, and forcing you to actively treat others with care and respect. It adds humor from misunderstandings and surprises. It keeps things interesting. So, you are alone. Who's to say that's not a good thing?

If you feel alone, even though your are not… then I suspect it is your subconscious bringing up this feeling… This is called a psychosomatic event… the subconscious mind is focusing on an unresolved, or unprocessed past experience… and so it just brings up the emotion to get your attention… here is my video on psychosomatic events. I am an Emotional Researcher, in this video I discuss Psychosomatic issues, and how the technique I discovered helps stop the Emotional Disturbance causing the manifestations.  That book I am holding up is what I use to target emotions. It works on this type of thing. Let me tell you some things about emotions… this is what you are dealing with. Have you ever heard of Emotional Charge? It is a psychology term for ..”Bottled up emotions”… Emotion means… Energy in Motion… so when this energy gets bottled up, it gives us a pressure, and this pressure can build and give us stress. Anger is a stress emotion. So is Hate… Pain and Hurt as well…and it gives us a shock…if you look at an incident… there was probably a shock at the beginning of it… that then changed into your emotional responses… Loneliness is no different… later go to my Quora Space page, near the bottom is a post on Loneliness. Watch the video. Now… The energy of an emotion, has an amount, intensity, frequency, and polarity… Lonely is seen as a negative polarity emotion, the state of being without companionship, missing people. So, emotions have a Charge… just like electricity… and so… Loneliness would be an Emotional Charge… it is an Energy Load, on us… so think of it this way… it is not Lonely… it is… “Lonely Charge”…see?
